intro: Cremanium hispidissimum, commonly known as the hairy cremanium, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other tropical plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Cremanium hispidissimum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
